If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What could someone be doing while performing that cannot be enjoyed by deaf people? Kyle's dads shirt cost $18 and had 20 butterflies on one sleeve and 22 on the other.  Kyle'a dad also bought two pairs of pants.  One pant had three butterflies on a sleeve and that pant cost $40. Choices: 1: 5 2.999999 3.000055<n>3.0001 4.0002 "A" "B" "C" "D" "E" "A"<n>Input:32.899 -3.4999 "A" "B")-0.4999 -0.51 "C" -"D" -2.99 -3.9<n><n>### Demo:<n>Answer: 37<n><n>### Question:<n>Input: How many letters are letters in the word?<n><n>### Explanation: This is a recursive call with a break to avoid infinite recursion.  The value of "how many letters are in the word" is passed to a recursive method named "f" with one letter of the word and 1 as the recursion depth.  The base case is an empty string with 0 characters.  The recursion is done once one more parameter (in this case depth) has been passed to f.<n><n>### Expected Output: "9"<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Expectd answer:<n>Input: How man letters are letters in the world<n><n><n>### Answers<n>The numbers I got were all incorrect<n><n><n>### Input<n>How many letters are in the list "happy"<n><n>### Exposed solution<n><n>Input:<n>"how many letters are in "happy"<n>How Many Letters Are Letters In Happy<n><n>class Solution:    <n>    def is_sorted(self, nums):<n>        def is_sorted(l):<n><n>            if l is None:<n>                return True<n><n>            if len(l) == 1:<n>                return l[0] <= l[1]

How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Choices:  A: war B: aircraft carrier C: sky D: graveyard E: crash<n><n>### Response:		If you're going to use your airplane, you've got to fly. If you're going into the sky to take off, there's no place for the plane to stay except on the runway. On the runway are other airplanes as well. Thus, the correct answer is D.<n><n>### Why you got it right, or why your solution was correct:<n>The answer "A: war" is incorrect because no airplanes in a war are going to be used. The war ends, the airplanes are destroyed, and there's no point in using them anymore.<n>The answer "B: aircraft carrier" is incorrect because an aircraft carrier can only hold those airplanes while they're going to or coming from a mission. While they're docked, airplanes can be made use of again. <n>The answer "C: sky" is incorrect because the sky is where airplanes are used in most frequent sense. If you're flying, you're already using them!<n>The answer "D: graveyard" is correct because, if they don't get to be used, they'll get broken and left there on land never to be used, not to mention that airplanes cost a lot of money, so it's cheaper to go to a graveyard then make one.<n>The answer "E: crash" is incorrect because, obviously, airplanes don't crash very often, and when they do, there's usually some reason for it.<n>

Choices:  A: redemption B: isolation C: absolution D: great relief E: feel better<n><n>### Response:		A. redemption<n><n>### Input<n>How many sides do you have if you play a game with a cube and two straight lines drawn on it?<n><n>### Response<n>Cube games can't be played with lines because the lines have dimensions. Cube games have only one dimension, which is why they are played with just the cube.<n><n>### InputHow many sides does a cube have?<n><n>###  Response: <n><n><n>    A cube has six sides, but they are all identical. So, a cube has six identical sides and six identical faces. The cube has six sides (2-dimensional figures) and six squares (3-dimensional figures)<n>    A cube is also known as an "orthohedral solid".<n><n>### Input   144<n><n>### Response :<n>A: 144 is exactly equal the surface area of a cube of unit length 1. Which means that all edges of the cube are equal!<n>This is because in a cube of length 1 each dimensions of the cube have the same unit length. So, this cube has to have exactly 1 length, 1 width, and 1 height. Also, when you calculate the surface area of this unit cube, you end up with 144, because you multiply the length 1 by the width, height, and volume. Each of these has unit length, and therefore the sum of them has unit length too, and so it will be equal to 144.<n>Besides not having side, the cube only has one surface, because it has only length, and height and has no width. Hence,<n>C: 144. The 1 dimensional cube is a unit cube because all of its sides are same length and there are six of them.<n><n>### How many points does a 3x3 magic 31 grid contain?<n><n>### Solution<n>A:   37<n>### How many blocks do you need to move in order to get every vertical 7-block sequence?<n><n>### B: 2<n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: concert B: home C: airport D: college E: university<n><n>### Response:		The golf carts are usually protecting the young adults at the home of the celebrity<n><n>### Input : The two best friends, Tuan and Tommy, decided to rent a movie for their house party. They were only allowed to pick one movie, but the two had opposite preferences. Tuan preferred action movies, and Tommy preferred horror movies. They agreed to flip a coin to decide which movie they should get. If there is a probability of 1/15 that the movie they get will match with their preference, then what is the probability that the movie they get is a horror movie?<n><n>### Response : <n>The probability that the movie they pick would be the horror movie is 3/15 since the movie they won has an equal chance of being horror as it is of being action. So the probability is 1/5 that horror is the movie they pick but the probability that horror is the movie is 3/5 which is the probability that horror is their third pick after the second pick.<n><n>### Input How much money must an employee save into her retirement account each month if she wants to save 7% of her annual salary by the end of the year?<n><n>### Respond  : $808<n><n>### Question:<n>Bruno is trying to fill a bucket with water. He places three glasses of equal volume on his desk and each of them is 3/4 full. He pours the water into the bucket, so that he can pour it in each of them again before he empties a glass. He repeats this procedure until he finishes the bucket. How many glasses does he have to pour for with to achieve this result? <n><n>### Response  : <n><n>Bruno needs to use 3/4 of the water each time for one glass and pour water to equal volume into the bucket because there is a 3rd of water that is already unaccounted for, which means that he could already use 1/4(3/4) since 4 x 1/4 = 3/4<n>The number of glasses to try is 1-(1+1+1-3/4), and this expression simplify down to (1/4).<n><n>### Input <n><n>Amy and Matt are both thinking about getting a coffee from Starbucks. They both have to pick

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What planet is the atlantic ocean part of? Choices:  A: books B: zoo C: body of water D: wooded area E: animals<n><n>### Response:		B The correct answer is B. The first choice in the list below could be a book that is made of wood, but not a source of wood, which is what a beaver usually builds structures to block. If a beaver build a structure to block a body of water, it could be a dam, which would block the flow of water instead of animals. The animal choice is another thing for a beaver to block, but only if it is near the water.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where could you find an armchair that is used by only a few people? Choices:  A: doctor's office B: hospital C: apartment D: study E: furniture store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demand<n>### Instructions: <n>When people buy goods or services, businesses must decide what amount to produce; if too much is produced, then businesses must choose whether or not to lower production.<n><n>### Answers for each question that show thought:<n>**Question 1:**<n><n>**Question 2:**<n><n>**(3x12) + (3x5) + 30**<n><n>**Question3:**<n><n>**4x12 + 4x7 - 10**<n><n>**(6x12) + 5 + 9**<n><n>**(8x10) + 16**<n><n>**Answer:**<n><n>**3898 â€“ 16**<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where is one likely to hear a harpsichord? Choices:  A: make noise B: band C: museum D: concert hall E: rubber band<n><n>### Response:		E - concert hall <n><n>### Input<n>Amy has 5 socks and 11 pairs of shoes. If she doesn't wear a sock with a pair, how many pairs does she wear (on different feet)?<n><n>### Response<n>7

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:How often are secular parties held? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		The secular parties are usually held every day, and they are crowd events that are held for a short term.<n>

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The robot shockingly began to read book after book, it had apparently done what? Choices:  A: choose one B: get comfortable C: bought a book D: learn to read E: open up<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input:-3 + 25 =_<n><n>### Response:-21<n><n>### Input-Sum of the first 100 prime numbers =_ <n><n>### Response-67<n><n>### Input+Subtract 10 from 100, get _<n><n>### Responseâ€“4<n><n>### InputMultiply 6 times a number, get...<n><n>### Response---36<n>```<n>

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:This city in Northern Norway is filled within things to do like Polar Nights half marathons and located in the middle of the Northern lights oval, which city is it? Choices:  A: northern B: nome C: tromsÃ¸ D: finnmark E: vadsÃ¸<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instruct and Demonstrate Input: There are 60 kids in a class. His animal was sitting at a table.  The man was sitting on a bench.  The man in green's foot rested on top of the table. For example the numbers 46,49,56,64,82,88,91 and missing number 85 follow this pattern.<n><n>### Test Instructions:<n>Answer the questions on the next several lines.<n><n>### Question 2:

Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Examples:<n>Exercising immediately leads to more energy, because with some exercise we can improve our bloodâ€™s circulation.<n>Because with more energy we can do more exercise and when we finish this cycle, we can have greater improvements.  <n><n>Exercising lead to some relaxation, because with more energy we can reduce our stress.<n><n>Exercise immediately leads to stronger muscles.<n>Exercising leads to more time energetic.<n>Exercises immediately lead to a reduction of chloresterol.<n>Exercise immediately lead to a greater strength of muscles.<n>Exercise is what causes energy.<n><n>Because we donâ€™t exercise we will get too much energy, because we will have more time to rest and to eat what we want, but sometimes we donâ€™t eat a healthy food.<n><n>Exercises lead to good sleep. Exercise is needed to improve our metabolism.<n><n>Exercsise leads to lose weight.<n><n>### Multiple choice:<n>#### Examples<n><n>Gail has some bills which amount to $15. Which is NOT a prime number?<n>ANSWER 1<n><n>Alice's age is twice Chris's age.  6 years from now Alice's age will be three times Chris' age.  How old are they now?

The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would you dispose of a broken icebox? Choices:  A: hear crowd go mad B: working hard C: clap D: reproduce E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>Input: I took some coins from a vending machine and there 40p into a jar. I took another 35p from the jar and put 1p in its place. I put 21p back into the jar and I took 15p back out. There were 5p left in the jar. How much did I started out with?<n><n>### Answer: I took 65p from the jar at the start.<n>```python<n><n>solution=get_input('What is the length of the line?')<n>input='The line is two miles long.'<n>### Input:<n>#I have an orange.<n>#The orange was eaten by a bear.<n>#The bear likes oranges but doesn't eat bananas.<n>#The bear killed seven dogs.<n>#The bear has three apples.<n>#The bear had one orange.<n>#The apple fell on the floor.<n>#The bear fell on the dog.<n>#The dog was bitten by the cat.<n>#The cat drank the milk and then drank the dog.<n>#There were two cats.<n>#The other cat had a hat.<n>#The other three cats had a hat.<n>### Answer:<n>#There were 5 orang<n>### Solution:<n>```<n>solution=get('What is the length at the start?')<n>### Input: The line is 3 kilometres long.<n><n>### Answer : The line was three miles long<n>### Solution: answer_at_start,answer_at_end<n>```<n><n>**Input:** _The_<n><n>### Answer<n><n>**Input: ** The line is two miles long.<n><n>## Solution (use a while loop):<n><n>```javascript<n>let solution = "";<n><n>const numberOfLineLengths = 2;<n>const inputChars = "The"<n><n>const lineLength = [];<n><n>lineLength.push(inputChars[0]);<n>for (let i = 1; i < numberOfLineLengths; i++)<n>  lineLength.push(inputChar + numberOfLineLengths)<n><n>console.log(lineLength);<n>let i = 0;<n>while (lineLength[i]!= null) {<n>  i++;<n>}<n>console.log(i)<n>```<n>

They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. The example question in the requirement above shows the format correctly.<n>-The response should be using the correct operation:Addition, subtraction, or multiplication/division <n><n>If the question asked for multiplication of fractions, the response should involve division.<n><n>Example 1:There are 55 students in the elementary school. 15 of them are in the 5th grade. How many are not in the 5thgrade?<n>-Answer=15<n><n>Example 2:The number is 85.12,086. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The person turned the oven on and put a pizza in, what happened one hour later? Choices:  A: smell smoke B: catch cold C: burnt D: look angry E: bank savings<n><n>### Response:		The pizza burnt<n><n>```php<n>$result = ($pizza['value'] - $oil['value'] - $water['value'] - gas['value']) - $smellSmell["value"];<n>```<n>

It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where can meat last a long time? Choices:  A: backery B: ham sandwich C: fridge D: butcher shop E: freezer<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>## Question<n> <n>In which place is meat most likely to stay fresh for a long time? 1. A: bakery 2. B: ham sandwich 3. C: fridge 4. D: butcher shop 5. E: freezer <n><n><n>## Explanation<n>I think the question is asking you to think logically about the question. <n>I am going with answer b because a ham sandwich doesn't have meat it has ham, I see the question as an analogy to meat, so if you take the meat out it's still fresh. <n>In short, the meat, if you think about it, stays a long time.<n><n>### Follow up<n>1. Whatâ€™s another answer besides A, B, D, and E?<n><n>I think the other answer is C, because the fridge is most likely to store the meat.<n><n>### Question<n>  <n>Why did you choose the answer you did?<n><n><n>### Explanation<n><n>I chose answer B because the answer to the questions is the ham sandwich. The thing with analogies is I think the person asking the question would like you to think it's common sense that a ham sandwich would have ham in it, and not meat. <n><n>### Follow-up<n><n>### Question <n>What if we switched up the question, â€œWhat is a cow most likely to find in a bakery?â€<n><n>### Explantion<n><n>I think I would of picked "hay" or something other than a ham sandwich if that's what the second answer to the previous question was.<n><n>### Comments<n><n>[A.M.221.23-10.2020.00001545](./src/test/resources/file/data/23-10-2020/1602007697797-AM221-23-10202000001.jpg)<n>![](/img/homeworks66/2.png)<n><n>![](/img/data/23102022.png)<n>![](/img-url/image.png)<n>![](#image_ref-153)<n>![](#image1_ref

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where is a tabby cat likely to be happiest? If it's 1/5 and 2/5 full already how much petrol should the car fill with?<n>### Response<n>A: 3/5<n><n>### Input and Demonstration:If a number is greater than a number by 5 and the bigger number is 1 greater than the amount left by deducting by one tenth of the bigger number.  Which of the following numbers can be represented by the equation if n = bigger number? <n>### Response:A:20<n><n>### Inputs and Demonstrations:  <n>Demonstration: <n>* D = divide.<n>* M = multiply.<n>* + = adding.<n>* - = minus.<n>* = equal.<n><n>Input: <n>* 20 D.S 9= 2;<n>* 10 M.S 8= 0.2;<n>* 4 D.S 4= 2;<n>D S. 3 =0.68<n>### Response=<n>* Divide by four and six.<n>* 10M.S 13= 6.6<n>* - 14 M.S 10= -9.6<n>* -14 D.S 9 = -13<n>* -14.68 D.S.6 = 9.04<n><n>### Input <n>- S =6.3 D.S. 12=9.61<n><n>### Response<n>* - 9.5 D.S. 9= -94.75;<n>* - 9 D.S.6= -108.<n>* -12 M.S. 10 = -120<n>* -12 D.S. 8= -144<n>* -12. 63 M.S. 6= -144.63<n>* 11 D.S 9.61 = 111.21<n><n>### Input

Choose the one that does NOT belong.<n><n>### Correct Answer:<n><n>Answer: The one that does not belong is E because we are asking about people stores. <n><n>### Example:<n><n>Example:<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: There is fruit at the bottom of the bowl. The bowl is 4/5 filled with fruit. How much fruit is at the bottom?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Answer:<n><n>### Output<n><n>Answer: 22.5<n><n>### Solution<n><n>The bowl is 4\(\frac{5}{10}\), which translates to \(\frac{22.5}{10}\).<n><n><n>### Input 2a <n><n>### Response 2a<n><n>Answer: <n><n>### Input answer 2a<n><n>Input: Sam is taking the test. The multiple choice question has four possible response choices, three are incorrect and one is correct.  Each question has 5 options and one of them is correct.  What is the probability of Sam getting all three correct answers?<n><n>Answer: 0.2<n><n>### Response answer 2a<n>Splitting your 3 choices of 1 and 2 into 66% and 34% the 98% minus 0.03, we are left with an answer of 98%.<n><n>The 5 options are 3. Therefore, the ratio is 3 to 2 (9:1).<n>We then divide the 66% by 9 and get 7:1.<n>Now we divide 7:1 by 3. This means that the answer to the ratio is 7:9.<n><n><n>### Output answer 2a<n>The 3 are incorrect, the answer to the test is correct and they are not mutually exclusive. Therefore, the probability or answer to 3 correct with 5 incorrect on the exam is:<n><n>Answer: 91.66666%<n><n>### Input example 2b:<n><n>Example:

Choices:  A: michigan B: map C: american city D: rest stops E: country<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct response is the only choice that is logical. Michigan. Map of US showing the location of the expressway and Michigan. This expressway is part of the Great Lakes Megway (the green line). It's located on the coast of Lake Michigan and as a US expressway it is one of the busiest expressways in America. There are six lanes going north and down on the coast of Michigan as well as an "extra" lane for merging. It is a toll road and it connects Chicago and Milwaukee (and all the places in between) and ends at Mackinaw City. If you have any questions or comments, please ask before rating. Thanks for viewing the comment.<n><n>*Rating: Good comment. I would like to know why you chose C.<n>

She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The people in class were instructed to brainstorm ideas, how would they use their minds for this? Choices:  A: shake hands B: control events C: talk to each other D: think creatively E: dress themselves<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### Input 1: Ginny worked so hard to reach her goal to win first place in her swimming meet. If she swam the last race again, what would she have to do to win the race?<n><n>Choice 1:<n> -  She would have to do better than her competitor.<n><n>Choice 2:<n> -  She needs to be in first place.<n><n>Choice 3:<n> -  She can still win the race because she is not swimming against anyone.<n><n>Choices:  A: she would have to do better at the last race in each lap. Which means she will need to swim with even more gusto and strength<n><n>### Response 1: A<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: This problem requires an explanation and a solution...<n><n>### Demotion:<n>Input:<n><n>Solution:<n><n>## Instruction:<n>Provide a solution to each problem.<n><n>## Instruciton:

Choices:  A: cook dinner B: make bread C: eat in restaurant D: have lunch E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		Cook dinner.<n><n>--------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Instructions:Create a conditional statement that completes the task.<n><n>### Example:<n>If a bear sees you,<n>the bear will attack you. You will die.<n><n>### If it is morning<n>   - Go to the store<n>   - If it is winter<n>     - you should go skiing<n><n>### Example Request:<n>If it is Monday and the teacher gives students detention,<n>then the students will eat their lunches before the end of the day.<n><n>--------------------------------<n><n>## Conditional Statement Format<n>The conditional statement can either be formatted as IF or IN<n><n>IF  <Subject> = <Comparison_Operator> <Comparison_Value>, then <Expression>, ...<n><n>  if <Subject> = <Expression><n><n>IN <Subject> <Comparison_Operator>,    <Comparison_Value> then <Expression>...<n><n>if <Subject> = <Value><n><n><n>-----------------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Request:If it is Monday and a person wears a green shirt to school, then give that person a ticket.<n><n>### Solution: IF <Subject>  = (<Comparison_Operator>) <Value> then    <Expression>,<n><n>---------------------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Instructon:Create the program in the given request<n><n>### Request :If it is night and the bear is hungry, the bear will get in the woods and try to find something to eat.<n><n>### Program:<n>IF  <Subject = <Value>, then,<n><n><n>------------------------------------<n><n>-------------------------------------------------------<n><n>  If it is night and the forest has a lake.<n>Whenever the bear gets in the woods.<n>Then wherever the lake is.<n>Eat in the water the carp that has a fishing hook.<n>So it can catch the carp and pull the carp into the woods.<n>

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Two friends wanted to spend a quiet evening together, what did they go see? He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:John ran out of pencils.  Where did  he go to get more? She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The judge did not take this part of the job lightly, the man was guilty but it was his passing sentence that condemned the man to what? Choices:  A: go to jail B: incarceration C: intercourse D: death E: judgement<n><n>### Response:		<n>> A: go to jails<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write code that appropriately completes this request, including any necessary error handling.<n>Your response code should run and complete the task in less than 100 lines.<n>The user code will be a sequence of user prompts, choices and responses.<n><n>### Input Format<n><n>* <code>input</code> - A string that contains prompts, choices, and responses.<n><n>* <code>.prompt()</code> - A function that takes one argument, the first character of the line. It should then print the prompt for that character. For instance if it is asked to print the prompt <code>.prompt('A').</code> will print the prompt <strong>A.</strong><n><n>* <code>/input</code> - The user must enter a string containing the choices and responses in order to complete the task. The user has access to 9 choices and 10 responses.<n><n>Example:<n><n>* user: <code>input</pre><n>* user input: <code>Mary had 89 stick...</pre><n>* prompt: <code>.prompt(M)</pre><n>* responses: <code>.prompts('R')</pre><n><n>### Output Format<n>Your code returns true.<n><n>### Constraints<n><n>* 66 lines of code<n><n>* no more than 20 variables<n><n>* no globals<n><n>### Example<n><n>```typescript<n>/* You can use any of the tests above for reference. */<n><n>/* Write your test code here. */<n><n>function calculateWages(input, prompt){<n>    console.log('Hello, world!')<n>    var workerSalary = parseInt(prompt(input))<n>    var overtime = true<n><n>    if (workerSalary < (prompt()) && workerSalary < 1000 && overtime){<n>        overtime = false<n>    }<n>    return workerSalary < (prompts(workerSalary))<n>       ? overtime<n>        : workerSalary<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Markdown<n><n>> Use **markdown** formatting to emphasize important points.<n><n>### Tests<n><n>```typescript{3}<n>import "./test.ts";<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:While laid up in the hospital she tried remembering good times, like that massage on vacation that brought great what? Choices:  A: dream B: knowing C: depression D: pleasure E: nostalgia<n><n>### Response:		A<n>

If a $1 coin has 21.58 grams of silver in it, how much silver is in 21 $1 coins?<n><n>This problem has a simple math solution, where we can easily determine that $21 * 21.5 = 459 grams.  However, the math will fail for a variety of other problems, e.g., there are different weights for different denominations for which arithmetic fails, e.g., the quarter is lighter than the dime.  The math fails for other reasons: for example, a coin, if shaped as a square of side l, has a volume V = l^2 h/2 where h is of length d where d = 2r.  Hence, a square shaped penny will have much more volume than a one-third-copper and two-thirds-zinc coin such as a dime, since the volume V = l^3/3h. In short, arithmetic fails to solve such problems because it fails even to give the answer to questions such as "how much silver is in 459 grins?" but it is also not enough to say "use log" because there are situations such as "how much does one-third-cooper and two-thirds zinc cost to one-

For example, name the variables for each task or else it will be unclear which of the script files are being edited each time you open it up for edits.<n>* You should start off all of your editable files with a description of its contents, followed by a comment of where the code will run in the web application.<n>* The web application you can use is located at [https://github.com/VasudevanA/MindsetQuiz](https://github.com%2FVasudevanA%2FMindsetQuiz).<n><n>### Instrument:A Game of Jeopardy<n><n>##### Task 1: Edit Jeopardy Script For a Game of Questions to Identify Strengths and Weaknesses<n><n>* The first task is to edit this Jeopardy script file and modify the following variables to reflect the content used in your Jeopardy game:<n>* **$questionText:** This contains the content to be displayed to the user (see section below).<n>* **$answerType:** One of the options below (which is used to determine whether or not the user was able to answer correctly).<n>    * This should be an empty string if the response type is incorrect:<n>    * 'Correct' when the response is correct:<n>    * 'Answer' when it only requires providing the answer:<n>    * 'Question' if the correct response is the question asked:<n>    * 'Blank' - when it requires a response of a blank spot:<n>* **$feedback:** The content that should be displayed to the user once they submit an answer (see section below). <n><n>* This will be a series of questions that asks:<n>* Whether or not the player has completed the task for the day<n>* Whether the player correctly answered a question (i.e., "How do you know if you're using Mindset 5 out of the day?")<n>* Whether or not they have correctly used Mindset

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What country has with the capital of Amsterdam has a Fortis bank? Choices:  A: netherlands B: utrecht C: brussels D: belgium E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		D.The Netherlands.<n><n>### Input and Response<n><n>Input: A t-shirt is 84% cotton and 16% polyester. If a boy takes half of the object out of half of the box, in what part of the box a boy will get the result? Choices: A: all B: 1/4 C: none D: whole E: middle <n><n>### Response:(E) The boy will get the result in the middle.  There will be 1/4 of the total object left if it were equally filled out.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The boy has a box and in it there is an object.  He takes out the object and takes out half the object out of half the box. He leaves a piece of the object out in the box.

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:A shop will give you what for your purchases? Choices:  A: downtown area B: container C: ocean floor D: the lost city of atlantis E: high school<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions: If it's one of their options to give you a container, then the number of times that container is being bought multiplied by the container's cost is what the shop is giving the customers for their purchases. If you bought 10 fish, one of the containers might cost $60, meaning that it's multiplied by 10, and $60 is what it's worth.<n><n>### Inputs:The shop will give you a reward for your purchases. What will be the reward? Choices: A: $6 B: $11 C: $14 D: $18 E: $23<n><n>### Response(s):C<n><n>### If the container's cost equals to 60, the $60 multiplied by the number of containers you have will be what the shop gave you for your purchases. The shop will give you the multiplier of the container's cost.<n><n>### The shop will give you a certain reward for your purchased fish. How much will the reward be for each fish? Choices: A.$1 B.$2 C.$3 D.$4 E.$6<n><n>### Response (s):C<n><n>The total amount given to you is multiplied by the number (30 here) with the multiple of that number's amount being multiplied by what the customer has paid. The customer gets paid for their own money used and how many (6 x 60) are used in all.<n><n>### A 44 year old person is two thirds older than another. Find the 6 year old person is?<n><n>### Instructioin: Write a programming language specific function that accepts a String and a Boolean parameter.<n><n>### In the example below, isString accepts the parameters â€˜â€˜aâ€™â€™and â€˜â€˜zâ€™â€™ (which are both Strings), and also accepts the parameter true (which is of type Boolean). true is interpreted as a String (a String is a special type of object in Java).<n><n>### The method returns a String in the format in the String parameter plus the String 'isString'. The format used can vary from the same example below.<n><n>### Note: this question is not about a method that simply determines whether a given string is a word, but rather a method that returns information in the format

Choose one: A: 15 B: 2 C: 3 D: 6 E: 7<n><n>### Response<n>Answer: A: 12<n>### Explain<n>Choices B - C: There are 3 ways to seat the first 3 girls and there are 4 ways to seat the next 2 girls. To seat the 3 boys, there are 5 ways to seat the first boy and 2 ways to seat the 2 remaining after placing the girls. <n><n>### Input, how does the dog know the cat is under the bed?<n>Answer: C: He can smell the cat<n>### Explain the dog can smell the cat because the cat peed under the bed and the dog could smell the pee.<n>### Response, how does the dog find the cat so fast?<n>Answer: B: It did a little tail<n>### Explain, a tail is a good pointer for dogs. <n><n>## TASK B. A<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Challenge<n><n>Write an expression that evaluates to the answer for each of the questions above.<n><n>#### Solution<n>##### 1. A<n><n>```python<n>if 89 > 0:<n>    remaining = int(89-(3*89))<n>else:<n>    remaining = 0<n>    print "Infiniy (0)"<n>if 3*89 + 7*2 < int(89-(4*89)):<n>    remaining = int((89-(6*89)) + (3*89)) - 3<n>if remaining < 0:<n>    print remaining<n>else:<n>    print "Not positive"<n>print remaining<n>```<n><n>##### 2. B<n><n>```python<n>#Input:<n>#Ans:<n>#Output:<n><n>if 90 > 0:<n>#<n>if 10 >= 0:<n><n>    def sum_dollar(num):<n>        total = 0<n>        curr = 0<n>        for i in num:<n>            curr+=i<n>            total+=curr<n>        return total<n><n>    num1 = 6 + 5<n><n>    print "dollars left: %s" %(num1)<n>    # print "dollar left: %s" (num1 -(6 + 5))<n><n>    if sum_dollar(65) >= 100:<n>        print "you have %s dollars left" %(sum_dollar(63))<n>    else:<n>        print (int(sum_dollar (63)))<n><n>if remaining >= 0:<n>    def rest(sum, num):<n>        curr = 7 + 1<n>        # print num<n>        # print num/len(num)<n>        # num1 = 123<n>        # curr = 6 + 4<n>        sum_left = num<n>        finalize = sum + sum_left<n>        print "dollars paid : %s" %(finalize)<n>        while curr >= 1:<n>            left = finalize - curr<n>            print "remain : %s" % (left)<n>            finalize = left + (sum_left)<n>            curr = curr -1<n>            if remaining >= final

If he travels 9 feet in the first step, 4 feet in the second step, and 2 feet in the third step, how many feet has he traveled?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Instructor Response: <n><n>Answering one question requires two responses: the actual answer and the process used to get to this answer.  This is critical for your instruction response and will give you a higher chance of scoring a higher grade. <n><n>You can either respond in the same way as the person who set the question, but it is better to develop your own understanding around mathematics in order to get a better understanding of where the reasoning comes from.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Four is the product of two numbers. If four times two is nine, what is one of those numbers?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>I am writing the same question as the instructor but taking a different approach, namely, understanding what these symbols mean:<n><n>```<n>Four is equal to two times two<n>2 * 2 = four<n>```<n><n>Since 2 can be made into a fraction:<n><n>```<n>2 / 1 = 2 or 2/2 equals 1<n>```<n><n>I can write the multiplication symbol as: `1 x (2 x 2)` or `1* *2`

Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		<n>```code<n><n>def solution(grade):<n>    if (grade=='A'):<n>        print('They are studying philosophy.')<n>    elif (grade=='B'):<n>        print('This indicates that they wish to become adults.')<n>    elif  (grade=='C'):<n>        print('There is no evidence for that.')<n>    elif<n>    (grade=='D'):<n>        print('It indicates that they are furthering their education.')<n>    elif(grade=='E'):<n>        print('Answer is incorrect. They are studying philosophy.') <n>```<n>### Challenge Questions<n><n>Input: There is a rectangular swimming pool of side 15 meters (m) and depth 1.05m. An adult person can walk around this pool in 800 seconds (s), 13 m shorter than a 150cm child. If 1 meter represents 1s, how many meters taller does an adult person compared to a 150 cm child need to swim across the pool in a second?<n><n>### Input and Challenge:<n><n>```code<n><n>challenge = ['Adult person: 800 seconds. Child: 13 seconds. 15 m shorter: 13 m / 800 s = 0.0167 m/s. So, an adult person needs to swim 0.0667 m shorter for each second.', '1 m = 100 cm. Therefore, the child needs 100 cm - 0.017 m = 99.983 cm per second. An adult person therefore also needs to swim 100 cm shorter for each second.', '5 m2 = 4.67m2 (0.5 m). 4.67 m2 / 0.4 s = 11.67 m2/s. Therefore, an adult person needs 11.66 m2/s]<n>```<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: small B: underground C: high D: huge E: tall<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:You're going to start practicing division using arrays (aka 1-dimensional matrices).<n><n>### Instructor's Tips:The arrays (a.k.a. matrices) are stored in alphabetical order using the'mat.' variable in this file: https://github.com/littlerubyduck/mystery_arrays/blob/master/mystery_division.py.  The'mat' object is located at the top.<n><n>### Input:"Find the total products of all integers in these arrays that are multiples of 5"<n><n>### Example:<n><n>>>> def find_products_of_5(mat5):<n>...     total_products = 0<n><n>>>> for i in range(len(array_nums)):<n><n>...     total_num = array_nums[i]<n><n>...     if total_num % 5 == 0 and (total_products % 5) == 0:<n>...         total_products += total_num<n><n>>>> print(find_products_of_3(mat5))<n><n>### Explanations:The first loop iterates through the arrays'mat2' and'mat3' starting at 0.  On each iteration of the loop, the inner loop iterates through the array and checks to verify if the number contained in the array is a multiple of 5.  The last line of the example function defines the product between the integer to be checked and the value of the previous line, or the value of 'total_num % 5' in this case.  On the last iteration of the inner loop, the function is checking the final value inside'mat4', and the value of 'total' will be multiplied by the product that is stored for 'i' which is the last index in the arrays'mat2','mat3', and'mat4'.  Remember'mat4' is stored in alphabetical order.<n><n>### Exercises:<n><n>### Instinct your Tips:<n><n>### Find the total products of all even integers in these arrays that is a multiple of 9<n><n>### Instict your Tips for this Exercise:<n><n><n>### Exercise:<n>You're using the same array object (mat4),

The first and second one's age together is more than the total of the rest but it's less than the sum of their ages separately. The total of the ages of all the three chickens together and the total of all the rest of the chicken's ages are even numbers. The first number in the sum of the chickens's ages is

Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		Love is A: contagious<n><n>### Explanation:A. You cannot explain love, but you can only feel it. You cannot force love from another. It is not painful, but beautiful. To love is to hurt, to be hurt, and to move on.<n><n>### Examples:<n>1. You love your parents. If you canâ€™t hug me right now, please know that Iâ€™m holding you in my thoughts and prayers.<n><n>2. Dad, I love you as much as I did when I was twelve. I love mom and I love my dorky brothers. I wish I could have been a better child and I hate that you had to take on parenthood solo and I know it was hard. I donâ€™t know if I can ever tell you what I really wanted to say, what I wish I had told you sooner because it feels like Iâ€™m just breaking a huge part of my heart to tell you this.<n><n>3. You know, they say one of the biggest acts of love is to give up on someone. For so long I couldnâ€™t give up on us, even when I knew our love wasnâ€™t worth it. But itâ€™s not a good idea to fight for something as long as this. There comes a time when itâ€™s better to let go. The hardest part is knowing, and seeing the signs, and not acting.<n><n>### Choice:C: last forever<n><n>### Explation:C. Itâ€™s hard to find the right words. But when love is true, you do not have to find the exact right words, because the feelings, and heart and emotion already tell the other person.
