Choices:  A: call 911 B: enjoy yourself C: get drunk D: having sex E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer from all the choices depends on what we're going to the party for<n><n>- **D:** If we go there to enjoy ourselves, we must call 911, get drunk, and enjoy ourselves.<n>- **A:**<n>- **E:** <n>- **B:**<n>- **C:**<n><n>### Next Steps:<n><n>### Task:<n>Implement an algorithm in the form of an instruction that satisfies the requirements in the instruction description.<n><n>### Hint:<n>The instruction given to you above is very different from the typical algorithms you have coded so far. It needs a new algorithm in order to satisfy the requirements.<n><n>### Solution<n>```<n>#!/bin/pw<n><n># Instructions:<n># Your problem is to find the smallest positive integer that is divisible by all the numbers specified on the instruction.<n># You can use a loop and/or recursion to implement your algorithm.<n><n>import re<n>def find_divisible(numbers):<n>    min_number = numbers[0] #The first element of the list.<n>    if len(numbers) == 1:<n>        if min_number % 1!= 0:<n>            min_number++ # Make it larger if it is not dived by 1<n>        return min_number<n>    else:<n>        for i in numbers[1:]: # The rest of the numbers.<n>            if min_number % i!= 0:<n>                min_number += 1 # Make it larger if min_number is not dived by i<n>        return find_divisible([x, 2 for x in numbers[1:]])<n><n># Test run<n># Instructions = ["2,34,40,47,30", 7, 10] #The problem<n># Instructions can have mixed numbers, whole numbers and decimal numbers.<n>for test in ["2,3,9,10,15,18,20", 6, 3, 5, 4, 2, 75, 50, 2, 15]:<n>    print(find_divisible(test))<n>```<n><n>### Code Review Template<n>1. The algorithm is clear to understand without reading the instructions.<n>1. The algorithm clearly

It is very obvious that this kind of formulation is inappropriate when you want to make a firm decision. The examples below demonstrate this. <n>	<n>"We will probably need to bring the boat in tonight as the forecast for tomorrow says there will definitely be some rough weather. But if the conditions aren't too bad we can postpone our action to the next day."<n>"The committee wants to keep the decision open until all our options have been considered carefully.  So we can take the matter up again at our next meeting."<n><n>### Demornstration input:"We need to take a decision.  But we don't know enough about the situation to make a firm one. So we'll have to wait for some more information before we can make up our mind."<n>### Demonration Input:" We need some information before we can make a decision."<n><n>### Demo Input:When deciding on an acceptable and clear cut compromise, the following words tend to be used.<n>### Demo Input:" The committee has decided to accept a temporary compromise in order to enable us to arrive at a lasting solution."<n>### Demo Input. "We are temporarily agreeing to a compromise to get on with looking for a permanent solution."<n><n>### Response "We are temporarily accepting the compromise to look for a permanent solution"<n>"The meeting has decided to compromise for the moment in order to get on with finding a permanent solution."<n>"The committee has decided to accept

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. Choices:  A: trouser leg B: sick bay C: own home D: petting zoo E: mother's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I will make the above decision based on the following information.<n><n>If I find a ferret in my trouser leg I would not need any attention.<n><n>When a ferret gets lots of attention it is at the petting zoo.<n><n>A ferret is unlikely to be found in sick bay. This is because it is likely to be found in the petting zoo instead.<n><n>A ferrets home is unlikely to be a place where it is getting lots of attention. It is more likely that it will be outside the petting zoo because the owners are giving the ferrets attention.<n><n>As a ferret may be getting lots of attention it is likely to be in my mother's hair. This is because a lot of cats will be in my mothers hair. The cat may even be sleeping in the petting zoo. Therefore, it is likely that the cat will be in the petting zoo because of the attention in receives.<n><n>A ferrett is unlikely to be in my trousers leg at any of the locations because it is unlikely a ferret will spend its entire life in a trousers leg.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>The likely places where a ferret is going to be is in my mother's head. The reason I know this is because a ferret is unlikely to sleep in my trouser leg. They are also unlikely to be in the petting zoos because they will be attending to it and giving it attention.<n><n>A ferretch will not be in my mother'd hair because they will not spend their entire lives in her hair. Therefore, they are more likely to be in the peting zoo.

Return all the strings as a comma-separated array.<n>### Demontration:<n>Input: The string "2434f73899" Output: ["2434f", "73899", ""]<n>Input: The string "" Output: ["", ""]<n><n>### Instructinos: Implement the function with two different methods. One method should calculate the area of a triangle given its base and height. Another method should calculate the area using the cross product of an entire set of points. Your code should use both methods in a way that prints out a message if all the points are equal (convex), if any of the angles is more than 180 degrees (concave), or if any of the angles are equal (isosceles). The message should be printed if the points are convex or equal. If the points are concave the message "The angles are not equal" should be printed.<n>### Demostration:<n>Input: the points of a triangle {0, 0, 0}, {5, 0, 2} and {5, 4, 4} Output: "The angles are not all equal"<n>Input: the points for pentagon {0, âˆ’2, âˆ’1, 3, 1,13} Output: "The points are convex"<n>Input: the non-convex points: {0, âˆ’5, 7, 2, âˆ’3,âˆ’2} Output: "The angle is 30 degrees concave"<n>Input: the convex points: {0, -4, âˆ’5, 4, -8} Output: "The point are convex"<n>Input:{0, 0, -3} Output: " The point is concave"<n><n>### Demostratinon:<n>The function areaCrossProduct takes coordinates as an input. If the coordinates are equal, the function returns a true value. Otherwise it returns a false value. The function returns a false value.<n><n>### Implementations:<n>### areaWithTriangle:<n><n>### areaWithC

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The new kitten hadn't gotten used to what it was allowed to climb on in most rooms, so the owned kept the bedroom door what? How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. Choices:  A: apartment B: pantry C: table D: living room E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input and Response:A<n><n>- I can't really think of where you can store dishes but not a lot of books.<n><n>- One place might be a kitchen.<n><n>### Input/Response:C<n><n>- I can think of living room.<n><n>- People usually will probably put books in books, but you would never put a book there.<n><n>- There are some exceptions though.<n><n>### Output:The answer is the pantry or kitchen.<n><n>## Other Solutions<n><n>- I always associate books and pantries for a place where they normally put a lot of books. This is especially true for children. A person would not store books and dishes in the same place.<n><n>- Someone probably puts a lot of books in the kitchen and puts a bunch of dishes in the pantry.<n><n>- You can go to a lot of books in a house and not put them in the living room.<n><n>### Solution:A<n><n>- You have a lot of exceptions. You do put a bunch of books up, and children are usually doing this. A lot of people normally put them in the kitchen.

He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What could there be in a beauty salon? Choices:  A: complications B: tiredness C: anger D: trial E: court case<n><n>### Response:		While multiple feelings may instigate the need for civil action, this is a question of feelings preceding the action. The choices which indicate an action in response, such as "A and B" and "D and E", are invalid. <n><n>Answer: D : Court Case<n><n>### Instructions:This question is a turtle. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The woman experienced great joy, but despite that this was a what? Choices:  A: misery B: sadness C: bad time D: sorrow E: play time<n><n>### Response:		The woman experience was great joy.<n><n>### Explanation: A great joy makes a person experience what makes us happy, but the great joy can also make misery to someone who is sad and sadness is also a feeling we experience.<n><n>### Input:"I was sad, but that didn't mean I was experiencing misery, despite that I was experiencing sadness." Choices:  A.B. C. D. E.<n><n>### Response:"I was sad, But that didn't mean that I was experiencing miseries that made me sad."<n><n>### Explation: Sadness and masure is experience but they doesn't means misery because they are experience but not a feeling or a pain that makes us sad that is misery.<n><n><n>### Input"The day she died was a sad day, but it wasn't a misery." Choices: <n><n>### Response"The day sad but it not feel the same"<n><n>### Explaination: Sadness and misury are the feelings that hurt but they are also experience that make us sad. But sadness and misury are different because sadness is just feels sad while misury is feelings that make us sad.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The department store is located in the Northwest USA.  Where might it be? Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the department store is not located is new york or a big city, then it might possibly be in other states in the U.S. As there are multiple towns, Idaho is not the only location where it might possibly be in. A shopping mall is a place or a venue that has a center of a location, but it mostly sells products that the different stores need to sell.<n><n>### Input:-12. -9. -9. -12. -9<n><n>### Response:-11<n><n>[![Instruction text for task, followed by response explanation](https://miro.medium.com/max/1300/1*mSzgZj27NXwV_QWKjfK3mA.png)](https://miro.com/app/board/uJOeNjIyQj8=/!D19853)<n><n><n>## Task Spec:This task specifies a task and provides the solution.<n><n>### Task-Description:<n>Input: Mary has 89 stickers <n>On the front page of her jar and 7 stickers to 6 other pages. <n>How many stickers does Mary has left over?<n><n>### Task Solution:<n>Answer: 43<n><n>## Task Runs-<n><n>### Task Demo Output:<n><n>### Task Demonstration Output<n><n>### Task Usage:<n>Uses a response with the appropriate answer.<n><n>### Expected Output:<n>Given that Task_1 is the task to be run, response1 and response2 are valid responses to the given task, task_output is provided for demonstration and a valid usage of the task is to display the response with the task_output.<n>### Pre-Conditions:<n>None.<n>### Post-Conditions:<n>Output is displayed and the task has been run properly.

Answer: I presented every single one of my accomplishments, including both work-related and volunteer activities, as they pertained to the job and displayed how I benefited the company every step of the way.George: How did you prepare for the interview? Answer: I interviewed for the job many times prior, so I was well prepared. However, I knew that this job was different, so I brushed up on my interpersonal skills and made sure to get plenty of rest before the interview.George: How does it feel to get the promotion? Answer : Amazing, fantastic, unbelievable! I just can't believe my hard work has finally paid off.George: What advice do you have for people who want to get promoted? Answer: My advice to anyone hoping to get promoted is to go to the extra mile when it comes to showing the management how much you care about the company and how dedicated you are in helping it succeed.

All three coin sets must be exactly $500 worth of coins.  The coin sets you receive must also be completely unsorted.  How can you do it?<n><n>### Dictionaries:<n>- a set is a group of the same thing arranged in order<n>- unsorted coins mean there isn't an order you can put them in, in terms of the number of coins for each type of coin<n>- complete means there must be enough copper of each to make each coin equal to the dollar amount<n><n>### Examples:<n>- if you have coins that are worth $352 you have 20 quarters, and 15 quarters worth $68<n>- if you have 261 dimes to be worth $261, that means there are 200 dime worth $261 each. Also then there are 12 dimes that are worth $0.01 each.<n>- if you have $150 worth copper, that means you need.000075 of copper to fill each quarter. That means there needs to be.00015 quarters in the set. That means the set must be one hundred and fifty quarters.<n>- if you only have $142 worth copper, the quarters are off by two. Also, the other sets could be off two too, so that $5 is only worth $4.20 worth of copper. That means that there must be only 66 quarters in the set, and there is no way of filling that coin set up to fill up $500. There must be only one set for the quarters because they aren't enough coins to fill $500<n>- if you have $.01 less copper than you need, the dimes will be off by two. The three sets have to be within one dime. That means if you have too little copper, there have to be only 199 dimes for the set. It

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. Choices:  A: fingernails B: garden C: corner D: computer E: closet<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B<n><n>### Explanation:For this question, the following variables are defined:<n>1.  $k\_1\_d$ is a variable called dirt<n>2.  $d\_a$ is a variable called fingernails<n>3.  $d\_g$ is a variable called garden<n>4.  $d\_c$ is a variable called corner<n>5.  $d\_p$ is a variable called planet<n>6.  $d\_i$ is a variable called inner<n>7.  $d\_e$ is a variable called closet<n>8.  $d\_2$ is a variable called $2$<n><n>The options are provided in decreasing order of probability that the student will choose each option. Options C and D are eliminated from consideration because they are only about the dirt and cannot be stored in the home itself.<n><n>Choices B and E are eliminated from consideration. According to the question, "dirt" is a variable and a variable is not stored in a computer.  The computer can only store information and not dirt.<n><n>As a result, choices A and C are left. Both choices A and C are valid options but A is the correct answer.<n><n>### Input:$d\_a+d\_e$<n><n>### Response:$30$<n><n>### Expltation: The variables are expanded to include all sub-variables.<n><n>This means that:<n>1. $d\_a$ includes variables $d\_e, d\_e\_2, d\_2\_e\_1$<n>2. $d\_e$ includes variables $d1\_2, d\_a$<n>3. $d\_g$ includes variables $d_a,d\_e,d\_c,d\_i\_2$<n>4. $d\_2$ includes variables $d\_\_e$<n><n>## Expected Output: 7.0<n><n>### The reason I chose the following<n><n>#### Choices: A, B, C, D, E<n>#### Instruction: Store bills in wallet<n>#### Demonstration: Put away dirt in closet<n>#### Input: A: dirt<n>#### Response: D: 100<n><n>#### Choices that were incorrect: A, B, D, E<n>

He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? What was the number of cars produced in February?<n><n>### Input2:<n>I am a very good artist. For every 6 drawings I make, 3 is perfect and 3 more have a mistake in it. What is my percentage of drawing mistakes per 24 drawings?<n><n>### response 1:<n>24 x 1/4 = 6.<n><n>### response2:<n>5/6 * 6 = 3<n><n>### Input3:<n>There are 14 people in the room. In every group of 4 people, each person has a different birth month. How many people are there in the room?<n><n>### response3:<n>4 groups x 2 months = 8<n><n>### Input4:<n>There are some children on the playground, and they have 30 marbles between them. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. The chairs are in the building.<n><n>Input:I wanted  a desk for people to visit me and speak to me, where did I have them put it? If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Dave put his beer where he could get to it, but it would be off the floor.  Where did he put it? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: closet C: can D: shelf E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Input :  If you buy a car that has 14,000 miles on it and then you drive it another 43,000 miles, how much more does it run?<n><n>Input: <n><n>Answer:  <n>`5,212.99`<n><n>### Instructions:Another word problem:If I have 5 quarters and one half-dollar and I have to buy a loaf of bread at a store, how much change will I get back? Explain how you figured it out.<n><n>### Answers:Answer:  I will get 25 cents back.<n><n>### To get change back<n><n>`If I spend 5 quarters`<n> <n>`On a loaf of bread that costs $2.50 ($2.75 to the nearest quarter)`<n> <n>`I would have to spend and extra quarter to get the total to even out`<n> <n>`Then I would get 25 ct`<n> <n>`I can do this because I have 10 quarters`

A question is asked about a 2 dimensional (squares and circles, not area) 3-dimentional object. <n>4. 2 questions asked.<n>3. Question about a real world situation, using addition and subtraction like making money (for example if you have 4 cents and spend 5, but you will get 4 for free). <n>3. A math statement with parentheses, using division and multiplication like (8646 / 32) (48 / 2). <n>2. Someone gets mad, and asks if it is a trick question.<n>2. A problem about a real world object, like how many bags of potatoes is 17 cents (17 cents would not be enough to buy 1).<n>1. A real world question like if I have a certain timeframe and only have $5.00; how do I figure it out.<n>

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What place would a person go to look at zebras? Choices:  A: zoo B: museum C: hospital D: desk E: opera<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is:E<n><n>### Input:(10)What letter follows the number 12 if the last 4 letters of the alphabet are removed?<n><n>### Response:(13)The correct answer is P<n><n><n>---<n>Â© 2020 Trilion Education LLC.<n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. Provide an adequate response that explains why the task would need to be completed.<n><n>### Task:<n><n>The average person in New Hampshire spends 15 minutes brushing their teeth. If you live in New Hampshire, how many seconds of brushing do you have to do to brush as much as the average New Hampshire resident?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>---<n>##<n># Instructions: Provide an explanation to explain your reasoning for this task.<n><n>### Reasoning:<n><n>---<n>If the average is 15 minutes, then that means the person took the seconds and divided it by 60. But it took 30 seconds to brush, so you need to multiply the value you get from the division problem by 5<n>

Answer: 322)<n><n>### Input  2:  George's bowling  team is one round away breaking a league record  most point per round they need to score an average score  per player 287. So, 4 players times 10 rounds times 287 is 10,400 (League record is 287 + 287+287+278). So, 10,420 + 10 - 20 =  10,448 or  48 less. So, they should score an average  score per player of 10, 448 per round.<n><n>### Input   2:Sophia eat 1/5 of her pie and she puts the rest on the frig. Choices: A: 12 B: 3 days C: 9 D: 48 hours<n><n>### Response A.<n><n>###Instruction:In 56 years, Mike has worked for 40 different companies. If he works in each of them for an average of 10 years per company, how many companies has he worked for?<n>### Demonstraiton:<n>10 x 50 = 500<n>500 Ã· 56 ( the number of years the worker worked with each company) = 9<n><n><n>Mike has worked for 9 different companies.<n><n>### Question<n>### Input: If 05/25-05/17 is the number of days in May, what day is Leap Day? Choices: A February B Sunday C Saturday D Wednesday<n><n>### Response B.<n><n>###<n>### Instruction : Solve the equations for x and y. Then draw a Venn diagram representing the possible values for x, y, and z.<n>x â€“ y = 4<n>3x â€“ 2 = 6<n><n>### Demostratin:<n><n>x = 4<n>y = 4<n><n><n>### 4 â€“ (4)<n>3(4 â€“ 2) = 6 â€“ 4<n><n>### 3<n>3<n><n>###5<n>5<n><n>###6<n>6<n><n>###4<n><n>###<n>Venn Diagrams are a simple yet effective strategy to solve problems involving multiple quantities. These diagrams can help you visualize the problem and solve it quickly and easily. <n><n>###<n>![Venn Diagrams.png](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30807432/149294155-30933558-b0ed-464e-9a9b-70095d630d5

She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What do horses do to get energy? Choices:  A: more rice B: own house C: warm coat D: light up E: read book<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Instruction:Answer the question below.<n><n>What are some of the basic human rights in modern times? Include why they are important.<n>#### Demonstration:What are some of the rights that people have that we should all be glad to have, and that are important for a fair and free society?<n>#### Input:<n>Sarah had a great time. She went on a road trip with some friends. There were six in the car, and two of them were in the front seat and four in the back seat. Sarah noticed that there were exactly 6 times as many pizza boxes left in the back. How many boxes were there in the back?<n><n>#### Response:6<n><n>### Clean up<n><n>```<n>// In the future we don't want to have to be sure that all nodes are in order<n>let a = 0;<n><n>// We want to use a variable as a placeholder, and pass a string into it<n>let b = '1';<n><n>// You could use something like this to find the smallest value in an array<n>let n = nums.reduce((a, b) => a < b? a : b);<n>```<n><n>```<n># In the future, we don't want the input array to be mutating as well<n>let i;<n><n>// We're going to mutate the nums array without making it an expression.<n><n>// We will create a variable holding the minimum value in the array<n>let numsMin = Math.min(...nums);<n><n>// Then we define our loop which will return the max num each iteration<n>for (i = 0; i <= numsMin; i++) {<n>    console.log(nums[i]);<n>}<n>```<n><n>### The new variable is now in scope, and will not be mutating our array<n>```<n># We are setting numsMin equal to the minimum number in our array. This is like the mod function to calculate the remainder<n>```<n>

The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The print was extremely small, as he was reading letter after letter he began to suffer eye what? Choices:  A: strain B: though C: happiness D: realization E: understanding<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions: What expression or sequence of expressions is needed to determine that the given expression is negative?<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>Input: -63<n><n>Output: -1<n><n>Input: x - y + 7<n><n>Output: -6<n><n>Input: x / \ (-5)<n><n>Output: x / -1<n><n>### Demands: Write a function expression that includes the two numbers and a function with a defined domain and range.<n><n>### Inputs:24<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Demons:<n>Input: function of x and y.<n>Answer 4.<n><n>Input: function of a,b<n>Answer 3.<n><n>Input:<n><n>### Instants:<n>If the number given is negative, use + to add the number to 10 and use - as if it was positive. Otherwise, use -.<n><n>### Response for example:<n><n>Output:<n><n>Input: function(a,b)<n>Answer 3.Input: function-function<n>Answer 3.If the given number is positive, subtract it from 10. If it's negative, add it to 10<n><n>### Demand:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demotape:<n>If you have 15.16 how many 4's do you need in order to get a total of 5 and which 4's you need to use?<n><n>### Instant:<n><n>Input:34.1<n><n>### Response <n><n>Input:35.3<n><n>Output 3 4's<n><n>### Insta:<n><n>Input:<n>Answer:<n><n>### Request: If 10 is a given number, how many whole numbers are there in between 10 and 11?<n><n>### Response<n>Input:<n><n>Output: 2<n><n>Input:<n>Output:<n><n>### Requirement: Use the number of cousins as the input and determine what the number should be in terms of letters?<n><n>### Input : 20<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Instances:<n>If 100 is the given number, what is the number of odd numbers between 100 and 101?<n><n>## #<n>##
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:If I have a reception with many people attending, where should I be sure to hold it? Choices:  A: grand casino B: large room C: restaurant D: country club E: lobby<n><n>### Response:		If I have a reception with an extravagant menu in a large room you should ensure that the room is decorated with the theme of your wedding.<n><n>### Credits:<n>Thanks to:<n>1. Choices:  A: lie down B: run away C: bite D: keep alive E: feel pain<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: There are a total of 30 people in the waiting room. 40% of the people in the waiting room work in IT. 30% of the people are younger than 30 years old. 8% of the people have the same name as a relative who has passed away. If 10 people work in IT and 5 people younger than 30 are older than 30, what's the total number of people in the waiting room?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Instruct: Answer the following statement.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>  Input:  At the bottom of the tallest hill in South City, there is a little pond.  The water depth is measured in feet.  During a drought the pond has a depth of 5 feet and stays that way while it rains.  After a rain the depth of the pond doubles from how much feet?<n><n>### Response :<n><n><n>### Instruption :<n><n>Input: Aaron is traveling 2 miles to the east of his current location and is traveling 10 miles to the south of his current location. How far is Aaron from his current location?<n><n>Answer: 15 miles<n><n>### Input :<n><n>Input: George has 16 coins. He also has 11 dimes, which is one more than three times the number of quarters he has. Whatâ€™s the number of quarters George has?<n><n>Answer: nine<n><n>### Demo :<n>Input: Harry has three dogs, two dogs are brown and each of the two brown dogs weighs four times more than one of the rest of his dogs. What's the name of the four-legged dog with the lowest body weight?<n>Answer: Baxter<n><n>Input: Three friends are riding in a car. There are two of them in the back and there is one in the front. If a bear is running 9 miles per hour faster than the car, when will the bear catch up to the front seat passenger?<n>Answer: 8.00 miles<n>Input: The length of a rectangle is one more than the width of the rectangle. If the area of the rectangle is 61 square feet, what is the width of the rectangle, in feet?<n>Answer: 9 feet
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:As a human in a large northeastern city, where can you see animals? Choices:  A: zoo B: workplace C: sky D: new york city E: many places<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If you chose (C), the sky - yes.  But if you lived in New York City - no you cannot see many animals in the sky.  You'll just see the airplanes!<n><n>### Instuction:<n>Write the correct answer to the question.  Answer:<n>If you are in New York City, you can see wildlife in the zoo.  There you can see the penguins, tigers, and other animals.<n><n>### Input : <n><n>E: many places D: new york C: sky B: workplace<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>The goal of this task is to teach the user the command "if" using examples.  This is the beginning of boolean logic.<n><n>### Example:<n>What if it were raining tomorrow, and you saw a dog on the street?  You might think the answer would be *"It was raining"* but this is not true.  It could rain while the dog was out being walked.  In this case, *"It was a sunny day"* would be the correct answer.  If you had seen the dog being walked, you could also include *"I would have needed to bring you an umbrella"* in your response.<n><n>### Response <n><n><n><n><n>### Input E: <n><n>B: workplace<n><n>If it was raining, I would have needed to bring the umbrella! I would have seen the dog being walked on the street.<n>### Input D: <n><n>C: sky<n><n>It was a sunny afternoon outside. I could see the puppy walking on the street.   The puppy was in a dog house today.<n>### Input A: <n><n>A: zoo<n><n>There are so many unique animals in the zoo. I could always see penguins, turtles, or birds at the zoo. I could go see the snakes!  How cool is that!  <n>### Input A<n>The puppy was happy and wanted to go outside. I tried but it was really cold outside.<n><n>### Correct Answer<n>If it was rainy, I would have needed an umbrella!<n><n>### Input B:  <n><n>B: workplaced<n><n>It was a fun and exciting day!  I got to see kittens

How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The jar was plastic, just like most of the stuff in the kitchen.  John preferred glass, and wished he was somewhere else.  Where does he want to be? Choices:  A: cupboard B: anywhere else C: everything D: own home E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Explanation<n>This is similar to the question of 'How many stickers do you have?' (Except the question was asked by 9-year-old girl named Jenny.) You should first ask John how many jars of jam there are (and write the number) then subtract it from the number of glass jars.<n><n>```<n>Input: A glass jar holds 1/4 cup of jam.  There are 5 jars in my fridge.  How many cups of jam do I have in my fridge?<n><n>Answer: 2 cups<n><n>(because there are 0.25 cups / jar, and 5 jars / fridge)<n>```<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Explination<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy a glass of wine? Choices:  A: art show B: basement C: bar D: church E: basement<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the answer.<n><n>A: Answer: B. Basement. (The wine glass is a drinking glass, not just a glass)<n><n>### Instructions:Select the appropriate answer and write it on the answer line.<n><n>### Inputs:You are 12 years old and spend one-third of an hour in your room. Your little sister wants to spend only one half of that time. How much time does your little sister have remaining when you wake up and leave the room?<n><n>### Output:<n>Input: You have 10 friends in your graduating class. Jack is half of what is left of the number of boys in the class. If the number of boys in that class is 5 lower than the number of girls in the class, how many girls are there in the class?<n><n>### Answer<n>465 (This is the correct solution to the puzzle, because you have to multiple 10 by 0,5)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:To locate a choker not located in a jewelry box or boutique where would you go? Choices:  A: jewelry store B: neck C: jewlery box D: jewelry box E: boutique<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: jewelry boutique and jewelry store<n><n>Input: A: jewelery box B: jewelery store<n><n>Output: A is correct and B is incorrect.

Which bar sold the least? Choices: A: 1.25 B: 1.12 C: 1.08 D: 1.5 E: 1.58<n><n>### Response<n>### Demonstator:<n>Input: A large store was sold chocolate bars, which bar sold the least?<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input : Mary and John were selling tickets for a charity event. John sold 3 ticks in 8 minutes. Mary took 3 seconds longer. Afterward, Mary sold 1 ticket in 9 minutes. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. Choices:  A: yard B: basement C: kitchen D: living room E: garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer:  A: yard<n><n><n>### Instructions: <n>Write a code snippet or function that will perform the task.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Inputs here<n><n>### Outputs:<n>Output here<n><n>### Assassignments<n><n>### Solution:<n>```javascript<n><n>```<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>```javascript<n>function completeRequest(data){<n>    let result;<n>    data.forEach((item, index) => result+=item || `No value`);<n>    return result;<n>}<n><n>function taskInstructions(input){<n>    let request={};<n>    request={input};<n>    return completeRequest(request.input);<n>}<n>```<n>

They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Though he could've kept going his body appreciated the rest, it had been constantly what during the day? Choices:  A: walk B: lay down C: working D: moving E: exercise<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The correct choice is "A." The passage has mentioned that the body could've kept going, implying the narrator had the body had more exercise.<n><n># 5 Question Answer Strategy:<n><n>### **Answer the following multi-part question.**<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: On each Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, Jim goes for a walk around the city center. The route he follows is shown in the figure above. To get as much exercise as possible while spending as little time as possible, Jim walks at his fastest, 6 miles/h. If the square is 2 miles away from his start point, at what speed could he also cover it before he had finished walking around the city center? (Remember you are walking at your fastest speed and you will be finished with this square only after you have completed the first walk of the day.)<n><n>Answer: 0.75 mi/h<n><n>Input: What is the smallest number that must be subtracted from 781 to give a 2-digit number that has a missing digit? (1) 78 â€“ 1<n>(2) 78 â€“7<n>(3) 783 â€“ 7<n>(4) 017 - 7<n>(5) 01 â€“ 7<n>(6) 789 â€“ 9<n>(7) 799 â€“ 9<n><n>Answer: (3) 78-3<n><n>### Examples:<n>### Input: 88 + 88 is the result of what operation?<n>### Demonstation:<n>88 + 8(88) = 8320<n><n>### Input is the answer.<n>### Explanations (1-4) answer A<n><n>### 1: 4<n>### 2: 3<n>### 3: 2<n>### 4: A<n><n>### Inputs that are not correct<n><n>### Input 5: 3<n>## Input 6: 4<n>## Input 7: 5<n>## Input 8: 6<n><n>### Input A + 8B is an answer choice but the question does not say to add two or remove a variable.<n>### Input B

She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Joshâ€™s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:I have something in my head I want to share, what ways can I do that? How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. Choices: A: a penny B: a thousand dollars C: a million dollars D: the entire galaxy E: a good feeling about yourself<n><n>### Response:\*\*Just because you make money doesn't mean you're satisfied. It's also hard to earn money even if it's not satisfying. It's possible to feel satisfied about making money.<n>

He is looking for some colors to choose from.  You have found some marbles that have the following colors:  a green one, a blue one, 4 orange ones, and 6 dotted ones.  How many dotted marbles are there?<n>### Your response:<n>There are no dotted marbles in his collection.<n><n>### Your answer is correct or incorrect.<n>Your answer is incorrect.<n><n>### Feedback to your response:<n>If there were dotted marbles, it means there would be a sum total of 7 dotted marbles. The total sum of all the colors = 4 + 5 = 9, which gives us the number of dotted marbles, which would be 9 - 7 = 2.<n>

I multiply the number on the left by 2, divide it by the original number on the right, and then add to the result the answer to my question, then I will see the result of my answer and the answer to my question in my mind<n>D:  Suppose I remove my shirt and show a group of 12 boys on Friday. On Saturday, I leave my shirt at my house, which is a different house than the first one.

If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:If somebody likes temperatures cool, they might have more than one electric fan where? Choices:  A: home B: hardware store C: home D: hot room E: office<n><n>### Response:		A: home<n><n>### Input<n>- 5 friends are playing checkers. how many games won they? How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. How many $10 bills are in her wallet?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:He had done a great job with the scary decorations, they were completely what? Choices:  (A) addition (B) addition of (C) both (D) not specified<n><n>### Input  : What does B mean?<n>### Response :  (A) addition<n><n>### Instruct: Write a program that answers the following multiple choice questions about a variable.Write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n>### Demonst: If a 2, and the remainder is 23, what is the remainder of when it is divided by 244?<n><n>In this case, input value of variable is 2 and we would require a remainder of 23.If we subtract 23 from 23 we get 1.The remainder of the value variable if divided by 243 is 1, so the required result is 1.<n>### Demostr: If a 9, and the remainder is -42, what is the remainder, when it is divided by -422?<n><n>Here if we subtract -42 from 9 we get -22.If we divide -22 by -422 the remainder would be -22.So the required answer is -22.<n>### Demotre: If a 43, and the remainder is (20)(3), what is the remainder, if and when (12)(1) has divided it?<n><n>If we divide 12 by 1, the remainder is 11. If we subtract 11 from 20, the remainder would be -9 and if we subtract 3 from -9, we get 0. So, after adding 11 and -9, the remainder is 0.<n>

The sum of its digits is 7. What is the number?<n><n>### Response : The 7 is in the tens column, so the number is 72.<n><n>### Error:The test has many possible errors, but you may have chosen the number 92 or 75 because<n><n>1) there are nine ones which sums to 9, or<n><n>2) a four and a five, which would sum out to be 90<n><n>If 92 or 90 is the number that you would write, you can still get full credit for the work using the correct method that I wrote above, and then using the test method below to correct your work.<n><n>### Test:Write your answer on the line below.<n><n>9 -> ___92<n><n>Answer: The correct answer is the following string:<n><n>**92**<n><n>### Instructions:How many pages are in a book that is 1024 characters long?  Choices:  A B C D<n><n>### Response<n>A: I have to divide what is in the book by what a page is, to get the number of pages that it has.<n><n>### Work:<n><n>A: 1024 / 56<n><n>A: 4 is a round number that is a divisor of 4.  A round number is one that has not been changed by decimals.<n><n>A: 8 is a number that has been changed by decimalties.<n><n>A: The number I would write is 4 pages.<n><n>### Response 2<n>C: I have to divide each character in the book by what each character is, and count how many characters are in the book.<n><n>### A: I would divide the characters for each line that is 45 characters, and I would write the number of lines that that would show me that 1024 would be represented as 54 rows.<n><n>###

How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: Gail has some bills in her wallet which amount to $100. She has four $5 bills and three $20 bills, and the rest are $10 bills. That makes it hard for people to grasp what's happening and how the budget cuts might impact them.  One example is a program to help families with four or more children. About 33,000 women rely on the Women, Infants and Children program in Arizona.  The state decided to cut that program by 70%, and women were justifiably alarmed.  So, one Arizona congressman decided to illustrate how big the cuts would be.  He laid his congressional salary and a $100 paycheck for his son on a table in front of his district office and asked a local reporter to stand in for the single mom.  Then he did the math with his hands.  That reporter wrote a story after that.<n><n>## Input question: What is a person doing (not saying) in the scenario presented? Choose from one of the seven actions presented in the word bank.<n><n>### Action:<n>    $15 million was cut from food inspection, which is the division of the U.S. Department of Agriculture responsible for ensuring the U.S. food supply is safe.<n><n>### Word bank<n>      A. standing<n>      B. standing up<n>      C. standing on<n>      D. standing still<n>      E. standing there<n>      F. stand up<n>      G. standing alone<n><n>### Question:<n>I am guessing the question is asking what the person wrote on the table.<n><n>#### Input: What are you looking to demonstrate?<n>### Answer:<n>I am going to demonstrate the way the food inspection division gets cut.  I will write the whole amount, $15, using crayons all over the bottom of the table and I will stand behind and write $15 million on some tape at the head of the table. I will get on top and turn the table upside down to indicate it will be cut.<n><n>### Answer Input - Is it a correct use?<n>Yes, correct use<n><n>### Demo Input - Is
